etymologies: Old English; earliest use found in Harley Glossary. Probably from early Scandinavian (compare Old Icelandic méldropi saliva or mucus from a horse's mouth from mél bit (cognate with Old English mīdl, mīðl, Old High German mindil, Old Swedish mila, milja (Swedish mile), Danish mile, and perhaps also classical Latin mandere) + dropi)

definitions: A drop of mucus hanging or falling from a person's nose.
